page.title: 10Geography and Ecology.
page.content: {Woodbridge}is situated on the upper reaches of the{River Deben.}It is situated on the western bank of the river.Nearly all old pasture land has been ploughed up as farmers no longer keep much livestock. Lots of land, formerly heathland and wet land has been changed into farmland and roads.New and bigger roads together with flats and houses and industrial development have now taken up large areas of pasture and woodland.Farmers are spraying chemicals that are supposed to kill pests, but as well as killing pests they kill butterflies, bees and field mice.The invention of modern machinery has meant lots of jobs but it has made work a lot easier and more efficient.The farms in our area are Gazebo Farm,Shrubbery Farm, Grange Farm,Willow Farm,Mill Farm and Gull Farm. {Kyson School.}
